Hello Guys,

I have to insert different images for different resolutions inside emails sent by HubSpot. Is it possible? If yes, how? I mean an image for desktop resolution, a different image for tablet resolution, and the last one for mobile resolution (all with the same external link). Thanks for your support.
I would do a simple test of a custom coded template (not using any of HubSpotâ€™s editors/builders) to narrow it down to if it's a code issue or not.
You'll also want to make sure in the media query you're including !important to override inline styles, I don't see that and it could be the culprit.

How are you building the email? The drag and drop editor won't allow for this but if you're coding the email then you can use a technique like <https://www.cantaloupedigital.com/resources/how-to-swap-images-for-responsive-emails/|https://www.cantaloupedigital.com/resources/how-to-swap-images-for-responsive-emails/>
Hello <@UKGV272KS> , thanks for your answer. I'm using the classical drag and drop editor. Can I implement this technique in a "drag-and-dropped" email with HubSpot Design Manager?
I don't know about the classical editor, you'll have to give it a go yourself and test it.
Thank you for this. I will give these things a try
